pull_request.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

update.description:
Some changes:

 * I would prefer not to mix under the same library name the different ABI versions. I've changed the 2 to libAtlasSimInterface2.
 * Both libraries are not installed under the default library path

This should work with catkin workspaces and also for building packages. Does no work on catkin_make_isolated since the devel/ space is different for every package.
update.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

pull_request.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

pullrequest.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

content.raw:
I did a quick test building packages locally, and it seems to work just fine. You can guess it with ldd, against AtlasPlugin and AtlasV3Plugin libraries. It only should appear the name of the library, not the path.

I need to investigate a bit more what is happening with the full library path in cmake. I would recommend the general approach of using -L to include link directories and -l library name, which in cmake is done using link_directories (or set_target_properties, be careful with the last one in precise, it is not fully supported) and target_link_libraries with just the library name.
content.html:
I did a quick test building packages locally, and it seems to work just fine. You can guess it with ldd, against AtlasPlugin and AtlasV3Plugin libraries. It only should appear the name of the library, not the path.

I need to investigate a bit more what is happening with the full library path in cmake. I would recommend the general approach of using -L to include link directories and -l library name, which in cmake is done using link_directories (or set_target_properties, be careful with the last one in precise, it is not fully supported) and target_link_libraries with just the library name.

pull_request.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

pullrequest.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

content.raw:
We could work with just one library name. yes. The risk is that you use a -lAtlasSimInterface and end up linking against the incorrect library. I think that this could be the case of pr #453:

```
jrivero@nium AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2 $ ldd /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasV3Plugin.so | grep Atlas
	libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 => /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 (0x00007f9dc1f4b000)
jrivero@nium AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2 $ ldd /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasPlugin.so  | grep Atlas
	libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 => /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 (0x00007fe9551b8000)
```

And if we don't provide a .so version of the libraries, the standard way of linking libraries (-lAtlasSimInterface) is not going to work.
content.html:
We could work with just one library name. yes. The risk is that you use a -lAtlasSimInterface and end up linking against the incorrect library. I think that this could be the case of pr #453:

jrivero@nium AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2 $ ldd /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasV3Plugin.so | grep Atlas
    libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 => /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 (0x00007f9dc1f4b000)
jrivero@nium AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2 $ ldd /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasPlugin.so  | grep Atlas
    libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 => /home/jrivero/code/catkin/drcsim_fix_default/devel/lib/libAtlasSimInterface.so.2.10.2 (0x00007fe9551b8000)

And if we don't provide a .so version of the libraries, the standard way of linking libraries (-lAtlasSimInterface) is not going to work.
